body:
That's a fair point. We already do have many moving parts.

So I suppose this requires a champion in the core team who's willing to take on whatever work there may be regarding this at release time.

On Sep 10, 2013, at 2:20 PM, José Valim <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I am aware of the pros. I just don't personally think any of them out-weight the fact it is yet another dependency. Even more if the functionality is being kept intact. Another dependency means more complication around the release process and another project inside rails/* to watch and maintain. See examples like Journey that was merged into Rails to avoid the unnecessary extra dependency and examples like rails/exception_notifications that we have removed from the rails organization because it was rotting.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
>
